page.title: 17Totternhoe Brownies
page.content: The Brownie Pack meets every Tuesday at 6pm until 7.30pm. They meet at the Scout hut. The uniform is a brown dress which has two pockets. There is a yellow tie with a silver badge on it to show which pack she belongs to. The uniform also includes a brown belt with a purse on it. In this they keep their inspection material, such as a 10p coin, a plaster, some string and a safety pin. Brown Owl, the leader, inspects the girls' uniforms and equipment regularly to see that it is clean and complete. On their heads they wear a brown bobble hat. Brown Owl is called Mrs.Curtis and Kiwi is Mrs. Clements. There are twenty-two Brownies in the village pack. There are some Guides as well. The brownies are divided up into groups led by a sixer and a seconder. Each group has its own name such as Gnomes.
